trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_SEQ_00<tab>Beq Lugg is ready to speak of the metaphysical.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Beq Lugg.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Magnus.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_TODO_02<tab>Search Mount Biran Mines for lumps of pristine clay.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_TODO_03<tab>Deliver the lumps of pristine clay to Beq Lugg.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_TODO_04<tab>Speak with Alisaie.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_000<tab>Corporeal and incorporeal aether... I confess I have never had cause to make the distinction.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_005<tab>Did they just say what I think they said? Might there really be a way to help Halric and the others? And help ourselves in the process?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_HALRIC_000_005<tab>...<mumble>
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_020<tab>I suspect the Crystal Exarch has told you of my past. That I was once a mage of the royal court of Voeburt, and that soulcraft was my field of study.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_021<tab>The tonic you administered to the patients here is one of the fruits of my labors. I hoped to do great things for the kingdom...
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_022<tab><sigh> But in the end, my knowledge brought only suffering. A plague the like of which none had ever seen.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_100_022<tab>In the hands of unscrupulous men, what should have been my greatest triumph instead became my greatest shame...
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_A1_000_000<tab>You mustn't dwell in the past.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_A2_000_000<tab>And now you have a chance to redeem yourself.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_A3_000_000<tab>At least the Warriors of Light brought those responsible to justice.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_025<tab>I know that only too well. Alas, the knowledge we require is steeped in such bitter memories.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_030<tab>That I do. A comforting thought indeed.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_035<tab>Aye, that they did. I shudder to think what might have happened had they not.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_040<tab>But let us return to the task at hand─finding a means by which we might revitalize these people's incorporeal aether.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_041<tab>Do you think it can be done?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_042<tab>Were the skies still ablaze with primordial Light, I would call it an exercise in futility. But now─now we may have a chance.

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_043<tab>The method I have in mind will entail the conjuring of a familiar. They are able to amplify the energies poured into them, making them the perfect conduit for the aether-revitalizing magicks we will ultimately employ.

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_044<tab>If you're about to launch into a lengthy explanation of the metaphysics of your plan─don't bother. I'd rather get on with doing whatever it is that needs to be done, if it's all the same to you.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_045<tab>Whatever reagents must be procured, or spells invoked─I'll do it.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_046<tab>...I admire your spirit.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_047<tab>Very well. Your first task will be to gather the necessary materials.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_048<tab>The purest of waters and finest of clays, as well as a fae lantern brimming with pixie magick.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_049<tab>If you're <var 1A 02 /var>convinced<var 1A 01 /var> the resulting familiar could help the patients─fine.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_050<tab>Alphinaud─the water and clay will be simple enough, but I think you know what we'll have to do to get the lantern.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_051<tab>You don't mean─
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_052<tab>The pixies took quite a liking to us before. If we humor them with our company, I'm sure they'll be willing to help us.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_053<tab>...

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_054<tab>...<var 1A 02 /var>Fine<var 1A 01 /var>. We'll pay a visit to Il Mheg. Though I never thought <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var> would be the one to suggest going back there.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_055<tab>I'm impressed you've been there at all, let alone befriended the fae folk.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_056<tab>Oh, while you're about it, seek out the Nu Mou of Pla Enni. They will be able to supply you with water suitable for our needs.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_057<tab>Right. Let's get this over with, shall we.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_058<tab>There still remains the matter of the clay. Might I prevail upon you to find it?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_070<tab>Clay from Amh Araeng would likely be best. Know you of anyone who might be able to assist us?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_Q2_000_100<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_A1_000_100<tab>I could ask the miners at Twine.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_A2_000_100<tab>Well, there are the scavengers at Mord Souq.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_075<tab>Ah, yes! They will be able to point you in the right direction, I am sure.

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_080<tab>Scavengers, you say? Well...they may know the lie of the land, but I daresay they are more interested in the trinkets and baubles hiding in the earth than the earth itself. Now, miners on the other hand...
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_081<tab>What's that? You know the miners of Twine? Perfect! Speak with them and you should have no trouble procuring what we need.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_085<tab>While you and the twins are occupied, I will see if there is aught else I can learn of the stagnation which afflicts the people here.

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_100<tab>I have no doubt that the miners of Twine can help you find what we need. While you are away, I will do what I can to learn more about the nature of the patients' affliction.

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_JERYK_000_105<tab>I can't stop thinking about that giant Talos we built. Can you imagine what it could do with a matching trolley? It feels like a waste <var 1A 02 /var>not<var 1A 01 /var> to build one.

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_THAFFE_000_110<tab><sigh> Sometimes I wish we'd never got that trolley running again. Now Jeryk wants <var 1A 02 /var>more<var 1A 01 /var> of the bloody things, and refuses to shut up about it.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_MAGNUS_000_120<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! Well, what a coincidence!
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_THAFFE_100_120<tab>You've come at a good time. We've just this moment finished repairing the Talos and trolley you lot took to Nabaath Areng.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_MAGNUS_101_120<tab>The trolley was no trouble, but the Talos would have been another matter, had we not had a visit from Master Chai.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_MAGNUS_102_120<tab>He offered us a share of the leftover building materials from Daedalus Stoneworks, as well as a few trade secrets to help us along.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_JERYK_000_121<tab>Clever man, that Chai-Nuzz. He seemed pretty keen on the ideas I had for putting the giant Talos to work.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_JERYK_101_121<tab>Like a giant trolley! But Magnus still refuses to see all the good we could do with it...
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_THAFFE_000_122<tab>You're entitled to your dreams, Jeryk, but that doesn't mean you can go harassing our guests with them. Master Chai was just being polite.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_MAGNUS_100_122<tab>And something tells me <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> here didn't come all this way to talk about trolleys. What is it you need, friend?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_MAGNUS_000_123<tab>I see. And this...familiar requires clay from Amh Araeng.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_JERYK_000_124<tab>Well, look no further. If anyone can find you some quality clay, it's us.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_THAFFE_000_125<tab>Saying that, it isn't exactly a commodity nowadays... But there must be some lurking somewhere or other, waiting to be dug up.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_MAGNUS_000_126<tab>If I'm not mistaken, there was a time when they used to take clay from Mount Biran Mines to make adobe bricks.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_MAGNUS_000_127<tab>Place is swarming with coyotes now, but if you're after the good stuff, you could do worse than to look there.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_JERYK_000_140<tab>I still say a trolley for that Talos is a good idea. You agree, don't you?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_THAFFE_000_145<tab>You'll want to be on your guard at the mines. Spend too long peering at the ground, and a coyote is sure to come and bite you on the arse.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_MAGNUS_000_150<tab>Stay safe out there. And remember: you don't need an excuse to come and visit us.

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_160<tab>The pixies were constantly confusing me with Alisaie. In jest, I assume. I mean, it's not as if we look <var 1A 02 /var>that<var 1A 01 /var> much alike! We, uh...don't look that much alike, do we?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_165<tab>That had better be the only thing we need from the pixies. If I have to endure one more prank, so help me gods...
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_200<tab>The twins have returned, and in one piece at that. I was convinced the pixies would turn at least one of them into a garden ornament...but no.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_100_200<tab>...You have the clay, I take it?

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_201<tab>Wonderful. We need but combine the clay and the water, then heat the mixture with the fae lantern. After that, it will be a simple matter of settling upon a suitable form, and performing the necessary incantation.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_202<tab>Beq Lugg. I have a question. In the event that we had need of this spell and you weren't around, would it be possible for another to perform the incantation?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_203<tab>Assuming they possessed the requisite skill, yes.

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_204<tab>Halric and the others have suffered so much, and I swore to do everything in my power to save them. If there is a chance this spell could do that, I would be the one to invoke it.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_205<tab>...Hmmm. Mayhap you <var 1A 02 /var>should<var 1A 01 /var> be the one to do so.

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_206<tab>A deep understanding of the subjects' physical state, combined with a strong desire to help them, can drastically increase the magick's effect. And you are plainly more familiar with these people than I.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_207<tab>I daresay there are few in all of Norvrandt more dedicated to finding a cure. Is that not so, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_Q3_000_200<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_A1_000_200<tab>Absolutely. She's the best woman for the job.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_A2_000_200<tab>Very few. But if aught should go awry...I'll see what I can do.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_210<tab>I'll give it my all. For Halric. For Tesleen...
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_215<tab>Is that a challenge? Well, I'll be damned if I let it come to that.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_220<tab>Then we are all of a mind on the matter. Alisaie shall be the one to conjure the familiar.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_280<tab>By the Twelve! Though it was only for a moment, he spoke! There may yet be hope for these people!
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_285<tab>The girl's resolve is quite impressive. One might almost think she drew strength from another...
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_HALRIC_000_290<tab>M... Mothe... Al...
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_300<tab>How is he, Beq Lugg? Did it work?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_301<tab>I believe it did. You and your fledgling familiar have done well.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_302<tab>If my eyes do not deceive, a hint of color has returned to his soul.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_303<tab>Gods... I would jump for joy if I weren't so exhausted.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_304<tab>We're so close now, Halric...

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_305<tab>As you are even now in the process of discovering, this magick asks much of the invoker. What you may <var 1A 02 /var>not<var 1A 01 /var> have realized is that the same is also true of the subject. As such, we must proceed with caution. However, with further treatment, I have the utmost confidence the boy will make a full recovery.

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_306<tab>Observing the reanimation of his stagnant soul has been most enlightening. I will need time to put my theories to the proof, but I believe I can fashion a spell to produce the opposite effect. That is, to <var 1A 02 /var>induce<var 1A 01 /var> stagnation.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_307<tab>Thus enabling our safe transport back to the Source via auracite!
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_308<tab>A thought occurred to me─about this treatment.

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_309<tab>Beq Lugg said when the soul is rendered dormant, the mind is separated from the body. That a person becomes incapable of interacting with the world around them.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_310<tab>Does that not sound a lot like some of the tempered back in the Source?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_311<tab>Not really. It is the fate of most tempered to become slaves to primals─save in a handful of cases. Or am I missing something?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_312<tab>If I can master this technique─the art of revitalizing the soul─I know of at least one in the Source who could desperately use such treatment.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_Q4_000_300<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_A1_000_300<tab>I'm not sure I follow...
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_A2_000_300<tab><var 1A 02 /var>Ga Bu<var 1A 01 /var>.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_A3_000_300<tab>Do you really think it could work?

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_315<tab><var 1A 02 /var>Ga Bu<var 1A 01 /var>. His condition is eerily similar to Halric and the others', the only difference being that his soul was suffused with earth-aspected aether from summoning Titan, rather than Light. It follows that if his soul is subject to a similar kind of stagnation, there may be a chance we can save him...right?

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_320<tab>Exactly! His condition is uncannily similar to Halric's, is it not? The only difference being that his soul was suffused with earth-aspected aether instead of Light. It follows that if his soul is subject to a similar kind of stagnation, there may be a chance we can save him...right?

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_325<tab>Why shouldn't it? Ga Bu's condition is virtually identical to Halric's, is it not? The only difference being that his soul was suffused with earth-aspected aether instead of Light. It follows that if his soul is subject to a similar kind of stagnation, there may be a chance we can save him.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_326<tab>Forgive me, but who is this Ga Bu fellow of whom you speak?

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_330<tab>...I see. His condition does sound similar...yet there is much and more about the soul that remains unknown even to me. I say this not to discourage you, you understand, but to remind you that this is delicate work we do here. Work requiring <var 1A 02 /var>patience<var 1A 01 /var>.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_331<tab>Of course. And as long as there is hope for the patients here, I will devote whatever time is needed to see this through.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_332<tab>But I refuse to spend that time in idleness. If it's all the same to you, I'd like to stay here with Angelo and continue with their treatment.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALISAIE_000_333<tab>The two of you should return to the Crystarium with Beq Lugg and see if you can't make some headway with their newly posited theories.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_334<tab>I would tell you to rest first, but I see you're not to be convinced. Ah, the fire of youth.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_335<tab>Let us return to the Crystarium, then.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_KAISHIRR_000_336<tab>(-???-)Finally! I've found you!
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_337<tab>Kai-Shirr!? What are you doing all the way out here?

TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_KAISHIRR_000_338<tab>There's trouble back in Eulmore. Lady Chai's beside herself. Sighing, pacing, the whole lot. Near enough <var 1A 02 /var>begged<var 1A 01 /var> me to go and find you.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_339<tab>...Sighing <var 1A 02 /var>and<var 1A 01 /var> pacing, you say? It must be urgent.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_BEQLUGG_000_340<tab>I take it I will be returning to the Crystarium alone. Go on, then. It's not as if I have anything for you to do.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_ALPHINAUD_000_341<tab>Thank you, Beq Lugg.
TEXT_LUCKMG104_03676_KAISHIRR_000_342<tab>Sorry for bothering you and all that, but she says the future of Eulmore's at stake.
